verses.roman:
upagīyamānau lalitaṁ
strī-janair baddha-sauhṛdaiḥ
sv-alaṅkṛtānuliptāṅgau
sragvinau virajo-'mbarau

synonyms: upagīyamānau—Their glories being sung; lalitam—charmingly; strī-janaiḥ—by the womenfolk; baddha—bound; sauhṛdaiḥ—in affection for Them; su-alaṅkṛta—finely decorated; anulipta—and anointed with (sandalwood pulp); aṅgau—whose limbs; srak-vinau—wearing flower garlands; virajaḥ—spotless; ambarau—whose garments.
translation: Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma wore flower garlands and spotless garments, and Their limbs were beautifully decorated and anointed. The women sang Their glories in a charming way, bound to Them by affection.
